development.name: Pita Bread
development.title: CEO
development.blurb: Baked goods enthusiast who dabbles in Linux and sets up networks for fun. Can be found writing long-winded emails, debugging strange wifi issues, or taking care of his extensive houseplant collection.

development.name: Xithical
development.title: CFO/COO
development.blurb: Having sold his soul to the IT administration gods many eons ago, you can usually find him working, going home to do work, or continuing to work in the support Discord.

development.name: Phil Tarrant
development.title: Creator
development.blurb: For best results, apply a thin layer of Phillip to code, cyber security, and parenthood for maximum effectiveness. Phillip often spends too much time with his chickens.

development.name: macgeek
development.title: Lead Software Engineer
development.blurb: Sysadmin for work and sysadmin for fun (avid homelabber). He enjoys a good tech tangent and gaming.

development.blurb: His interests include Linux, gaming, and helping others. When he's able to unplug he enjoys biking, hiking, and playing soccer.

development.name: Zedifus
development.title: DevOps Manager
development.blurb: A Streamer, who is currently working in the insurance industry, self-teaching software development & DevOps, with the hopes of a career change! Enjoys playing games and has a sassy cat called Eve.

development.name: Silversthorn
development.title: Software Engineer
development.blurb: Developer at work and at home, testing his own code is a pain, so his coding precept is "Testing is Doubting"

support.name: iSilverfyre
support.title: Community Manager
support.blurb: Silver enjoys helping others with their computer needs, writing documentation, and loving her cat.

retired.name: Quentin
retired.title: Document Curator
retired.blurb: Hosts Minecraft servers for his weird friends, works for an IoT company as his dayjob. The 's' in IoT stands for 'secure'.

retired.name: Kornster
retired.blurb: Day to day I am a Network Administrator, dealing with a range of vendors and products. Outside of work my hobbies are handyman things, such as carpentry and motor mechanics having grown up around them. My home-lab consists of Linux distros ranging from Debian, Ubuntu & Centos having self taught myself Linux for the last 12+ years.

retired.name: Kev Dagoat
retired.title: Head of Development
retired.blurb: His interests include Linux, programming, and goats of course. He enjoys building APIs, K8s, and geeking over video cards.

retired.name: Manu
retired.blurb: His interests include learning, Linux, and programming. He enjoys speaking French, doing 6 things at once, and testing software.

retired.name: UltraBlack
retired.blurb: Hi, my name is Tim, and I'm a huge fan of linux. I'm often gaming and occasionally coding.

retired.name: MC Gaming
retired.blurb: His interests include learning, Linux, and programming. He loves pentesting apps and gaming.

retired.name: ThatOneLukas
retired.title: Software Engineer
retired.blurb: Arch Linux enthusiast who likes 80s/90s music, Rust (The programming language) and light distros like Arch Linux btw. Dislikes C, C++, Go, and Microsoft. Also doesn't like Finnish weather that freezes molten snow to (deadly) ice.
